title: Strengthening Software Development Practical Competencies: Community-Engaged Co-Curricular Approaches for Pharmacy Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary pharmaceutical knowledge and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can collaborate with community organizations to perform over 120 hours of volunteer work, providing drug counseling and health education services.
Learners can develop patient-centered communication strategies by applying the humanity and caring domain of Fink’s Taxonomy of Significant Learning.
Learners can propose sustainable pharmaceutical interventions to address community health issues through semester-long project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
